text: [narrator] Previously on Love Island Australia…

This will be the hardest decision
I've had to make.
I do have to hurt someone.

The boy that I'd like to couple up with
is Jordan.
Callum.

There is only one person who can save you.
[narrator] That was new bomb Ben.

The girl I'd like to couple up with
is Stella.

Layla, darling, you've been left single
and you are now dumped from the island.

Tonight…

'Cause it's just as fine as yourself,

Oh, my God.

I'm really excited to see where things go.

"Are you good enough?
Are you who you thought you were?"

[inhales] You're in a room full of people,

[narrator] And turmoil!

if there's no trust.

so what would you like me to do?

for you.

one of you is about to be dumped

has come as a massive shock.
It's gonna take Callum seconds to get over it.
[Callum] Big night.

You've had a couple of big nights
in a row now, fuck me.

I didn't expect it
to go down like that, but--

-I'm just going off what I feel…
-[Callum stammers]
…based on our conversations.

And multiple times I've asked
if you're open and you have said yes.

Obviously if you had said no,
then obviously I wouldn't have picked you,

-'cause that's weird.
-Yeah.

it's my own fault,

and I was having a flirt,
and I wasn't closed off.

I didn't want to be closed off to her,
but I didn't expect this outcome.

-No, no, no.

No, no. I don't regret
saying the things I said,

but I think it's gonna take me
at least a day or two to reset.

Because I feel like I've been--
not smothered,

but Layla's been everywhere with me

Vakoo knew she had to do
what she had to do.

She's not gonna pick
the second-best bloke.

She's gonna pick number one,
and it's obviously me.

-I don't even expect anything…

…from you right now,
'cause I know it's a lot.

You just lost someone.
So you're kind of in mourning.

-Yeah. I'm not grieving.
-[laughs]
I'm like, "It's Love Island 2022, come on. I've only known the girl for a week."

No, Callum, it's okay.
You're grieving, this is a huge loss.

-Fuck, I'm sad.
-I will give you your space and your time.

-I'm here. I want to get to know you.
-Yeah.

-And that's just-- That's-- Yeah.
-See what happens.

It's nice to know
that he's not completely closed off,
and he's willing to give it a chance.

It's gonna make it easier
that Layla isn't here.

was harder than doing derivative maths.
Now he's chosen, he can get his pencil out,
and start working on finding a square root.

to know you a bit more.

I really want that.
